result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lexus Marie Pickett

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
The original document was titled: Pretrial Assessment Report
The original history event date is: 10-31-2022
Pretrial Assessment Report. Filed by JSC. Reviewed by SRN. SEALED. kma

Includes 22CF740 and 22CT267

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  D.Kelly.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONLY. 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:47 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C. Dillon, Clerk: B Harris,Defendant Lexus Marie Pickett in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Lexus Marie Pickett.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF740 (INIT) and 22CT267 (INIT).  As to 22CF740- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  As to 22CT267- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Bond argument.  Court orders bond.  DE given PFAC.  Court schedules  next hearing.  Speedy prelim waived for CF file. Adjourned at 1:51 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
